details:
DrWhax reports:

> So in codeconv.c there is a function for Japanese character set
> conversion called conv\_jistoeuc(). There is no bounds checking on
> the output buffer, which is created on the stack with alloca()
> Bug can be triggered by sending an email to TAILS\_luser@riseup.net
> or whatever.
> Since my C is completely rusty, you might be able to make a better
> judgment on the severity of this issue. Marking critical for now.
summary: claws-mail -- no bounds checking on the output buffer in conv_jistoeuc, conv_euctojis, conv_sjistoeuc
